required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Infant Formula on the Growth and Tolerance in Preterm/Low Birth Weight Infants
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Infant Formula on the Growth and Tolerance in Preterm/Low Birth Weight Infants

brief_summary.textblock: This is a two stage open-label, single-arm, multicenter and observational study.

detailed_description.textblock: Stage 1: In hospital, preterm/low birth weight infants less than or equal to 34 weeks gestational age at birth, birth weight of ≥ 1000g to <1800g and conditions meeting the enrollment criteria will be fed formula with or without parenteral nutrition until discharge. Stage 2: Post-discharge, all infants with birth weight < or =1500g will be followed on formula per standard of care and accepted standard of care including feeding until the infant's weight >or= 25th percentile of growth expectation based on corrected age (P25) or until infant reaches 9 months corrected age.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from first feeding to discharge (up to ~8 weeks)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from first feeding to discharge (up to ~8 weeks)
Change from first feeding to discharge (up to ~8 weeks)
Time from Birth to discharge (up to ~8 weeks)
From first feeding to discharge (up to ~8 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: vomiting, abdominal distension, gastric residuals, stool abnormalities, necrotizing enterocolitis

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From discharge to 9 months corrected age
secondary_outcome.description: From discharge to the time point that infant's weight >or= 25th percentile of growth expectation based on corrected age (P25) or until infant reaches 9 months corrected age.

arm_group.description: Preterm infant formula per standard of care

intervention.intervention_name: Preterm infant formula per standard of care
